get.summary: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the server.
get.description: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the server. The URL is short and suitable for posting on Facebook, Twitter etc. Note: The user must be authorized to share (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to share files with anyone). Since 1.6.0.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song, album or video to share. Use one id parameter for each entry to share.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

post.summary: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the server.
post.description:
Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the server. The URL is short and suitable for posting on Facebook, Twitter etc. Note: The user must be authorized to share (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to share files with anyone). Since 1.6.0.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`).

id.description: ID of a song, album or video to share. Use one id parameter for each entry to share.

description.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

expires.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

get.summary: Returns a list of random, newest, highest rated etc. albums.
get.description: Returns a list of random, newest, highest rated etc. albums. Similar to the album lists on the home page of the Subsonic web interface.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of albums to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The list offset. Useful if you for example want to page through the list of newest albums.

parameters.name: fromYear
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byYear'`. The first year in the range. If `fromYear` > `toYear` a reverse chronological list is returned.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byYear'`. The last year in the range.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byGenre'`. The name of the genre, e.g., â€œRockâ€.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.11.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

get.summary: Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes.
get.description: Returns all Podcast channels the server subscribes to, and (optionally) their episodes. This method can also be used to return details for only one channel - refer to the id parameter. A typical use case for this method would be to first retrieve all channels without episodes, and then retrieve all episodes for the single channel the user selects.

parameters.description: (Since 1.9.0) If specified, only return the Podcast channel with this ID.

parameters.name: includeEpisodes
parameters.description: (Since 1.9.0) Whether to include Podcast episodes in the returned result.

get.summary: Downloads a given media file (HLS).
get.description: Creates an HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) playlist used for streaming video or audio. HLS is a streaming protocol implemented by Apple and works by breaking the overall stream into a sequence of small HTTP-based file downloads. Itâ€™s supported by iOS and newer versions of Android. This method also supports adaptive bitrate streaming, see the bitRate parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the media file to stream.

parameters.name: bitRate
parameters.description: If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If this parameter is specified more than once, the server will create a variant playlist, suitable for adaptive bitrate streaming. The playlist will support streaming at all the specified bitrates. The server will automatically choose video dimensions that are suitable for the given bitrates. Since 1.9.0 you may explicitly request a certain width (480) and height (360) like so: bitRate=1000@480x360

parameters.name: audioTrack
parameters.description: The ID of the audio track to use. See `getVideoInfo` for how to get the list of available audio tracks for a video.

schema.description: Error response TODO: TO BE DESCRIBED

HLS is a streaming protocol implemented by Apple and works by breaking the overall stream into a sequence of small HTTP-based file downloads. Itâ€™s supported by iOS and newer versions of Android. This method also supports adaptive bitrate streaming, see the bitRate parameter.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: A string which uniquely identifies the media file to stream.

bitRate.description: If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

get.summary: Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the serverâ€™s audio hardware.
get.description: Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the serverâ€™s audio hardware. Note: The user must be authorized to control the jukebox (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to play files in jukebox mode).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The operation to perform. Must be one of: get, status (since 1.7.0), set (since 1.7.0), start, stop, skip, add, clear, remove, shuffle, setGain

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Used by `skip` and `remove`. Zero-based index of the song to skip to or remove.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: (Since 1.7.0) Used by `skip`. Start playing this many seconds into the track.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Used by `add` and `set`. ID of song to add to the jukebox playlist. Use multiple id parameters to add many songs in the same request. (set is similar to a clear followed by a add, but will not change the currently playing track.)

parameters.name: gain
parameters.description: Used by `setGain` to control the playback volume. A float value between 0.0 and 1.0.

post.summary: Controls the jukebox, i.e., playback directly on the serverâ€™s audio hardware.
post.description:

get.summary: Saves the state of the play queue for this user.
get.description: Saves the state of the play queue for this user. This includes the tracks in the play queue, the currently playing track, and the position within this track. Typically used to allow a user to move between different clients/apps while retaining the same play queue (for instance when listening to an audio book). `id` is optional. Send a call without any parameters to clear the currently saved queue.

parameters.description: ID of a song in the play queue. Use one id parameter for each song in the play queue.

parameters.name: current
parameters.description: The ID of the current playing song.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position in milliseconds within the currently playing song.

get.summary: Registers the local playback of one or more media files.
get.description:
Registers the local playback of one or more media files. Typically used when playing media that is cached on the client. This operation includes the following:

* â€œScrobblesâ€ the media files on last.fm if the user has configured his/her last.fm credentials on the server.
* Updates the play count and last played timestamp for the media files. (Since 1.11.0)
* Makes the media files appear in the â€œNow playingâ€ page in the web app, and appear in the list of songs returned by getNowPlaying (Since 1.11.0)

Since 1.8.0 you may specify multiple id (and optionally time) parameters to scrobble multiple files.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to scrobble.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0) The time (in milliseconds since 1 Jan 1970) at which the song was listened to.

parameters.name: submission
parameters.description: Whether this is a â€œsubmissionâ€ or a â€œnow playingâ€ notification.

* Updates the play count and last played timestamp for the media files. (Since 1.11.0)
* Makes the media files appear in the â€œNow playingâ€ page in the web app, and appear in the list of songs returned by getNowPlaying (Since 1.11.0)

get.summary: Streams a given media file.
get.description:
Streams a given media file.

OpenSubsonic servers must not count access to this endpoint as a play and increase playcount. Clients can use the Scrobble endpoint to indicate that a media is played ensuring proper data in all cases.

If the server support the Transcode Offet extension, then it must accept the timeOffset parameter for music too.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to stream. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

parameters.name: maxBitRate
parameters.description: (Since 1.2.0) If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: (Since 1.6.0) Specifies the preferred target format (e.g., â€œmp3â€ or â€œflvâ€) in case there are multiple applicable transcodings. Starting with 1.9.0 you can use the special value â€œrawâ€ to disable transcoding.

parameters.name: timeOffset
parameters.description: By default only applicable to video streaming. If specified, start streaming at the given offset (in seconds) into the media. The `Transcode Offset` extension enables the parameter to music too.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: (Since 1.6.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Requested video size specified as WxH, for instance â€œ640x480â€.

parameters.name: estimateContentLength
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0). If set to â€œtrueâ€, the Content-Length HTTP header will be set to an estimated value for transcoded or downsampled media.

parameters.name: converted
parameters.description: (Since 1.14.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Servers can optimize videos for streaming by converting them to MP4. If a conversion exists for the video in question, then setting this parameter to â€œtrueâ€ will cause the converted video to be returned instead of the original.

post.summary: Streams a given media file.
post.description:
Streams a given media file.

OpenSubsonic servers must not count access to this endpoint as a play and increase playcount. Clients can use the Scrobble endpoint to indicate that a media is played ensuring proper data in all cases.

If the server supports the Transcode Offset extension, then it must accept the timeOffset parameter for music too.

Requires OpenSubsonic extension name `formPost` (As returned by `getOpenSubsonicExtensions`)

id.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to stream. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

maxBitRate.description: (Since 1.2.0) If specified, the server will attempt to limit the bitrate to this value, in kilobits per second. If set to zero, no limit is imposed.

format.description: (Since 1.6.0) Specifies the preferred target format (e.g., â€œmp3â€ or â€œflvâ€) in case there are multiple applicable transcodings. Starting with 1.9.0 you can use the special value â€œrawâ€ to disable transcoding.

timeOffset.description: By default only applicable to video streaming. If specified, start streaming at the given offset (in seconds) into the media. The `Transcode Offset` extension enables the parameter to music too.

size.description: (Since 1.6.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Requested video size specified as WxH, for instance â€œ640x480â€.

estimateContentLength.description: (Since 1.8.0). If set to â€œtrueâ€, the Content-Length HTTP header will be set to an estimated value for transcoded or downsampled media.

converted.description: (Since 1.14.0) Only applicable to video streaming. Servers can optimize videos for streaming by converting them to MP4. If a conversion exists for the video in question, then setting this parameter to â€œtrueâ€ will cause the converted video to be returned instead of the original.

f.name: f
f.description: The response format. Must be 'xml' or 'json'. For the purposes of this document, only `json` is allowed.

apiKeyAuth.name: apiKey
apiKeyAuth.description: [OS] An API key used for authentication. If specified, `p`, `t`, `s` nor `u` can be specified.

legacyPassword.name: p
legacyPassword.description: The password, either in clear text or hex-encoded with a â€œenc:â€ prefix. Since 1.13.0 this should only be used for testing purposes. `u` must be specified.

token.name: t
token.description: (Since 1.13.0) The authentication token computed as md5(password + salt). `u` and `s` must be specified. See https://opensubsonic.netlify.app/docs/api-reference/#authentication for details.

salt.name: s
salt.description: (Since 1.13.0) A random string (â€œsaltâ€) used as input for computing the password hash. `u` and `t` must be specified. See https://opensubsonic.netlify.app/docs/api-reference/#authentication for details.

protocolVersion.name: v
protocolVersion.description: The protocol version implemented by the client, i.e., the version of the subsonic-rest-api.xsd schema used (see below).

clientName.name: c
clientName.description: A unique string identifying the client application.

code.description:
The error code.
* 0: A generic error.
* 10: Required parameter is missing.
* 20: Incompatible Subsonic REST protocol version. Client must upgrade.
* 30: Incompatible Subsonic REST protocol version. Server must upgrade.
* 40: Wrong username or password.
* 41: Token authentication not supported for LDAP users.
* 42: Provided authentication mechanism not supported.
* 43: Multiple conflicting authentication mechanisms provided.
* 44: Invalid API key.
* 50: User is not authorized for the given operation.
* 60: The trial period for the Subsonic server is over. Please upgrade to Subsonic Premium. Visit subsonic.org for details.
* 70: The requested data was not found.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

Line.description: One line of a song lyric

value.description: The actual text of this line

start.description: The start time of the lyrics, relative to the start time of the track, in milliseconds. If this is not part of synced lyrics, start __must__ be omitted

lang.description:
The lyrics language (ideally ISO 639). If the language is unknown (e.g. lrc file), the server must return `und` (ISO standard) or `xxx` (common value for taggers). Ideally, the server will return lang as an ISO 639 (2/3) code. However, tagged files and external lyrics can come with any value as a potential language code, so clients should take care when displaying lang.

Furthermore, there is special behavior for the value xxx. While not an ISO code, it is commonly used by taggers and other parsing software. Clients should treat xxx as not having a specified language (equivalent to the und code).

synced.description: True if the lyrics are synced, false otherwise

line.description: The actual lyrics. Ordered by start time (synced) or appearance order (unsynced)

displayArtist.description: The artist name to display. This could be the localized name, or any other value

displayTitle.description: The title to display. This could be the song title (localized), or any other value

offset.description: The offset to apply to all lyrics, in milliseconds. Positive means lyrics appear sooner, negative means later. If not included, the offset must be assumed to be 0

structuredLyrics.description: Structured lyrics. There can be multiple lyrics of the same type with the same language
